summary: This is a fundraising email from Lori L. Cohen, Executive Director of ECPAT-USA, sent on GivingTuesday 2020. It outlines the organization's work to combat child sex trafficking and online exploitation, mentions Jeffrey Epstein's case as an example, and promotes a matching donation campaign with Carlson.

persons.name: Lori L. Cohen
persons.context: Author of the email, leading the organization's efforts against child trafficking and exploitation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as an example of a pedophile trafficker who built an empire exploiting young girls.

persons.name: George Floyd
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of his killing sparking protests and discussions about systemic racism, which ECPAT-USA connects to vulnerabilities in sex trafficking.

events.description: ECPAT-USA hosted a webinar with the creators of the Netflix documentary 'Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich' to explore how power, privilege, and demand fueled an international sex trafficking scandal.

keyFacts: ECPAT-USA describes Jeffrey Epstein and his accomplices as having built a 'flourishing pedophile empire that exploited young girls from vulnerable communities.'
The organization connects systemic racism to increased vulnerability to sex trafficking, citing insights from its Survivors' Council.
ECPAT-USA partnered with the American Hotel & Lodging Association and Marriott International to offer free training to hotel staff to identify and report suspected child sex trafficking.
The email promotes the EARN-IT Act, legislation ECPAT-USA is urging Congress to pass to combat online child exploitation.
Carlson provided a matching donation offer, doubling contributions up to $2500 for ECPAT-USA's GivingTuesday campaign.
